Monday, June 25, 2007























Senators vote to boost car fuel standards
Senators reached agreement Thursday on a proposal to increase automobile fuel economy standards to 35 miles per gallon, the first significant boost demanded of automakers in nearly 20 years.
FULL STORY


























The Situation Room, weekdays 4 p.m. & 7 p.m. ET
Watch "The Situation Room," anchored by Wolf Blitzer, for complete, up-to-the minute coverage of the day's events. Tune in to "The Situation Room" weekdays from 4 to 6 p.m. and from 7 to 8 p.m. ET.

For a daily sneak preview of the show and an early read on the day's political news sign up for "The Situation Room" daily email newsletter at http://www.CNN.com/situationroom.






















Waxman: Cheney avoided oversight
Vice President Dick Cheney's office refused to cooperate with an agency that oversees classified documents, House oversight committee Chairman Henry Waxman said.
FULL STORY






Bush vetoes stem-cell bill
Pushing back against the Democratic-led Congress, President Bush vetoed a bill that would have eased restraints on federally funded embryonic stem cell research.
FULL STORY






Edwards' nonprofit questioned
When John Edwards pursued his crusade against poverty in 2005, he created a nonprofit center that allowed him to maintain a high profile -- and avoid the scrutiny of presidential candidates.
FULL STORY






Bloomberg leaves GOP
After declaring that he is leaving the Republican party, New York Mayor Michael Bloomberg did little on Wednesday to quiet the fierce speculation about a possible independent presidential bid.
FULL STORY
